page.title: 08FARMING -CHANGES
page.content: {CHAPEL FARM}displays many of the signs of change in local farming. It is a highly mechanized farm. It shares the use of about 40 implements with other farms in the group e.g.{ {forage harvester,turbo-tiller.}These represent a capital outlay of some Â£300,000.{A dairy farm}also has an expensive outlay for milking equipment. The{E.E.C }suffers from an overproduction of milk and has enforced quotas on member countries. Local output is therefore being restricted and Chapel may increase beef stock to maintain its income. Land use in the area shows an increase in{oilseed rape}with its vivid springtime yellow.Hedges are being removed thus making the machining of crops easier.
